(Simplified: 鲈)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 盧 indicates the sound; 魚 (fish) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 魚 [ yú ] fish
    • 盧 [ lú ] cottage, hut; black; surname
①(鱸魚)體側扁，嘴大，鱗細，背灰綠色，腹面白色，身體兩側和背鰭有黑斑。生活在近海，秋末到河口產卵。爲常見的食用魚類。
鱸魚 [ lú yú ]: bass; perch

鱸字的基本解释

鱸
lú
见“鲈”。

鱸字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lú］
［《廣韻》落胡切，平模，來。］
亦作“魲1”。“鲈1”的繁体字。
(1)松江鲈鱼。杜父鱼科。鳃膜上各有两条橙黄色的斜纹，古人误为四鳃，故又称“四鳃鱸”。鳞退化，体呈黄褐色。生活在近岸浅海，夏秋进入淡水河川后，肉更肥美，尤以松江所产最为名贵。
(2)鮨科鲈鱼。体侧扁，巨口細鳞，背部灰绿色，腹面白色，身体两侧和背鳍有黑斑。夏季进入淡水，冬季返回海中。我国沿岸浅海均产。

鱸字的康熙字典解释

【亥集中】【魚字部】　鱸； 康熙笔画：27； 页码：页1480第24
【廣韻】落胡切【集韻】【韻會】龍都切，?音盧。魚名。【正字通】巨口細鱗似鱖，長數寸，有四腮，俗呼四腮魚。以七八月出吳江，松江尤盛。天下之鱸皆兩腮，惟松江四腮。【後漢·左慈傳】所少吳松江之鱸魚耳。【註】神仙傳云：松江出好鱸，魚味異他處。【晉書·張翰傳】見秋風起，思松江蒪羹鱸鱠，命駕歸。

Basic explanation of words
bass
lú
See "Perch".
bass
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [lú]
["Guangyun" Luo Huqie, flat model, come. ]
Also known as "魲1". The traditional characters of "Ling 1".
(1) Songjiang perch. Du Fu fish family. There are two orange-yellow diagonal stripes on each gill membrane, which was mistaken for four gills by ancients, so it is also called "four gill perch". The scales are degraded and the body is yellowish brown. Living in the shallow sea near the coast, after entering the freshwater rivers in summer and autumn, the meat is more plump, especially from Songjiang.
(2) Serranidae perch. The side of the body is flat, with a large mouth and fine scales, the back is gray-green, the ventral surface is white, and there are dark spots on both sides of the body and dorsal fin. It enters fresh water in summer and returns to the sea in winter. It is produced in shallow waters along the coast of my country.
bass
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Collection] [Fish Character Department] 　 Perch; Kangxi Strokes: 27; Page Number: Page 1480 Page 24
[Guang Yun] Luo Hu Qi [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Long Du Qi,? Yin Lu. The name of the fish. [Zhengzitong] A huge mouth with thin scales resembling a mandarin fish, several inches long, with four cheeks. It is commonly called a four-gill fish. Out of Wujiang in July and August, Songjiang is especially prosperous. Every perch in the world has two cheeks, but Songjiang has four cheeks. [Later Han·Zuo Ci Biography] Wu Songjiang's bass ear. [Note] The fairy tale says: Songjiang produces good perch, but the fish smells different from other places. [Book of Jin·Biography of Zhang Han] Seeing the autumn wind rises, I think about Songjiang Pingan Perch, and I will come home.
